author: sabpol
title: Classic Space Set
review: This is a great little Space set.  It has a solid-built feel with its 6-stud wide chassis, not including the wheels.  With wheels, it's 10 studs wide.  I like the yellow space man and the movable shovel.

author: Rollo_Tomassi
title: Diggin machine!
review: I don't normally give smaller sets more than a three, but I really got a kick out of this set when I bought it today.  It has a VERY wide axle.  It is wider than many of the older vintage sets are long.  Which makes it very sturdy and look exactly like it's a moonbase excavator.  It has TWO computers and some cool tubes on the side, as well as useful tools like a spanner and pickax.  Mine was missing the two red trans rockets on the back, but I hardly miss them because now it looks more utilatarian.  It even comes with four yellow 1X1 flats as 'alien rocks' to scoop up.   Despite it's low brick count, this is a fun little set. I enjoy it quite a bit.

author: AETerry
title: Space Dozer Review
review:
Classic Space.... there was a lot of fun to be had with many of these sets. This set was no exception, though more of my enjoyment came out of taking the elements and using them in other MOCs. Still, this is a good set, you get a Classic Yellow Space Minifigure and a few accessories.

 

The build was fairly simple though very ulitarian at the same time. Large oversized tires to suggest a Space Vehicle. yellow 1x1 plate elements to use as ore samples that the minifigure is collection, computer consoles, "bazooka" radar type mount for either scanning or protection. There's a lot of fond memories tied up with these Classic Space sets.
